intro: Flosmutisia paramicola, commonly known as the Paramicola flosmutisia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
